item.title: Marvel’s Wolverine Developer Refused to Confirm or Deny 2025 Release Window
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/insomniac-refused-to-confirm-or-deny-marvels-wolverines-release-window/

According to a new interview with Insomniac, Marvel’s Wolverine may or may not be released in 2025. 

During a conversation with Variety (via IGN), the new co-heads of Insomniac, Ryan Schneider, Chad Dezern and Jen Huang, were asked whether Marvel’s Wolverine is still slated to release in 2025. Dezern didn’t confirm or deny the release window but stated they would “love to talk more about Wolverine”, as the title has already been announced. Still, they must “be like Logan today and remain very stoic until it’s time to pop the claws down the road”. 

Dezern added that they will have to hold on to their “pent-up excitement” for Marvel’s Wolverine, and that’s all they could speak about their upcoming projects during the conversation. Marvel’s Wolverine was announced during a PlayStation Showcase in 2021, where a small snippet showcased the character’s iconic claws. Since then, we have yet to hear any official announcements for the game; however, much has been revealed through the leaks. 

During the same interview, the Insomniac heads also expressed interest in “game-to-screen adaptations.” Ryan Schneider spoke about the Ratchet & Clank film and how they “got an early start on that.” Schneider added that they are “interested in that kind of thing,” and the team loves Ratchet & Clank in particular. 

In other news, Marvel’s Wolverine’s creative director has joined Xbox’s Perfect Dark team. Also, Insomniac confirmed that no additional story content is coming for Marvel’s Spider-Man 2. Do you think Marvel’s Wolverine will release in 2025? Let us know in the comments below or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the GTA 6 parody game Grand Taking Ages, launching on Steam. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly

item.title: PocketPair Publishing Joins Forces With Surgent Studios on a New Horror Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pocketpair-surgent-studios/

PockerPair Publishing and Tales of Kenzera: Zau developers Surgent Studios have announced that they’ll be joining forces, with PocketPair supporting the development of a new horror game at Surgent.

Taking to X (formerly Twitter), the publisher said, “We’re pleased to announce that our first project as Pocketpair Publishing will be supporting a brand new horror game from Surgent Studios. SURGENT STUDIOS is a studio with an original approach, and Pocketpair is excited to support them to the fullest extent. Please look forward to future announcements for details of specific projects!“

Insider Gaming reached out to Abubakar Salim, the Founder of Surgent Studios, about the deal. Salim said, “I think it’s wonderful that PocketPair Inc. is taking their successes and channeling them into artists and supporting the medium of making games. It’s an incredible honour to be a part of their journey, and there’s a lot more to share over time.”


PockerPair found its success last year with the launch of Palworld, which saw the player battling Pokemon-like creatures but with guns.

PocketPair Publishing said on the deal with Surgent Studios, “We understand the challenges of creating your dream game. At Pocketpair , we’ve been fortunate to find success. Now, more than anything, we want to use that success to help other developers achieve theirs.“

The game hit a peak concurrent player count of 2,101,867, making it one of Steam’s highest-ever concurrent player counts. As of February 22, 2024, the company announced that the game sold 15 million copies on Steam and had reached 10 million players on Xbox.

Who do you think PocketPair Publishing will pick up next? Join the discussion and let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Shroud might start a Marvel Rivals team and DOOM: The Dark Ages Gameplay Footage Leaks Online Ahead of Xbox Developer Direct

item.title: GTA 6 Parody Game ‘Grand Taking Ages’ is Launching on Steam
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/gta-6-parody-grand-taking-ages-steam/

The developer of the GTA 6 parody game Grand Taking Ages is launching on Steam after a revamp.  

A little over a month ago, a title called Grand Taking Ages VI popped up on the PlayStation Store, and it felt eerily similar to Rockstar’s highly anticipated 2025 release, GTA 6, with both games even having the same acronym (GTA VI). After a closer look, it was revealed that Grand Taking Ages VI was a game development simulator where the player manages a studio while tackling obstacles that developers encounter while creating the game. The title was recently pulled from the PlayStation Store due to its controversial appearance. 

However, a report from IGN reveals that Grand Taking Ages, the GTA 6 parody game, is now launching on Steam while remaining pulled from the PlayStation Store. The developer, Violarte, stated that their approach towards Steam differed, as they “engaged with the team” early on with the game’s concept before the official submission. For its approval, the game underwent a “thorough” review process to be listed on the platform. 

After arriving on Steam, you can spot key differences in the GTA 6 parody game’s listing. Grand Taking Ages has dropped the number ‘VI’ from the title. Additionally, they have new screenshots, a fresh trailer, and a revamped description. These changes were made to “clearly differentiate Grand Taking Ages from the original inspiration, GTA 6, and to emphasize its unique direction.”

Grand Taking Ages developer also addressed the PlayStation Store listing, stating they “strongly believe” that the new changes should be enough for the game to return to the platform. The game is slated to release in July 2025; check out its new description: 

Coming Soon Since Forever! Start your game dev journey in Mom’s garage! Battle angry fans, dodge ruthless journalists, and perfect the art of “creative” deadlines. Survive on pizza and energy drinks while building your dream studio into… a slightly better garage!

In other news, Rockstar Games has shut down the GTA 5 Liberty City preservation project. Also, the developer is still promoting a 2025 release window for GTA 6. What are your thoughts on the GTA 6 parody title getting relisted on Steam? Let us know in the comments below or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about EA stating that Dragon Age: The Veilguard didn’t meet expectations. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Pokémon Center London 2025 Pop-Up—Start Date, Where To Find It & What To Expect
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-center-london-2025-pop-up-start-date/

London is calling for a 2025 Pokémon Center Pop-Up store. Bringing an exclusive Pokémon merchandise pop-up store to the UK is an annual tradition, and you need to know its start date, what’s there, how to get there, and how to book your spot.

There is high demand for the Pokémon Center London 2025 pop-up—and rightly so! It’s an early celebration leading up to the Pokémon International Championships 2025 for one. But it gives excited Pokémon fans the chance to grab merch that can’t be found elsewhere.

With limited slots and many vying for entry, let’s deliver a Quick Attack on the crucial details.

Pokémon Center London 2025 Pop-Up Date & Times

The Pokémon Center London 2025 pop-up officially opens on February 20 and closes again on February 23. The shop’s working hours vary between 10 AM and 6 PM—depending on the day.

Four short days are permitted for the 2025 London pop-up shop. But the shop gets a fair few hours to be open, trying to guarantee as many people get in and get a chance to buy merch as possible.

Here’s a complete schedule for you to bookmark.

Where is The Pokémon Center London Pop-Up?

ExCeL London is the location of the 2025 Pokémon Center London pop-up store.

EGX goers might recognize the venue as it’s where the annual four-day gaming convention occurs. The official Pokemon Center blog post says to find the pop-up store, “Via Entrance N1 of ExCeL London, and it’s located within a flat, no-barrier hall.“

How to Reserve Spot And Book Slot For Pokémon Center London Pop-Up 2025

You must visit the Pokémon Center London 2025 pop-up registration page and fill out your details to secure a spot.

Unfortunately, if you head to the registration page now, it has a message for visitors: “Store Reservations Are Filled.“

However, extra spots may open up down the line, so I’ll post some instructions here, just in case:

  1. Find your nearest device with an internet browser.
  2. Go to the Pokémon Center London registration page.
  3. Fill out the details.
  4. Choose your slot time and date.
  5. Confirm the booking.

What To Expect From Pokémon Center London Pop-Up

The store offers a huge range of exclusive merchandise, particularly for the Pokémon International Championship 2025.

The official event description promises “Exclusive International Championship merchandise” at the Pokémon Center EUIC Store! These products, and many more, will be available at the Pokémon Europe International Championships Pokémon Center! ” and many more items.

A bonus treat awaits if you’re going on Sunday as there are “Additional character appearances and a scavenger hunt at the store geared toward our young Pokemon Fans!

Availability for the Pokémon Center London pop-up is always tough. There are limited spots and thousands (maybe millions) of eager Pokémon fans desperate to get in. Let us know if you secured a place for the pop-up shop.

We have more Pokémon news and content from McDonald’s Promotion offering special Pokémon cards through Happy Meals to the latest on Pokémon TCG Pocket’s rumored A2 Set.

item.title: Shopify Rebellion Becomes First VALORANT Game Changers Team to Qualify for Challengers
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/shopify-rebellion-becomes-first-game-changers-team-to-reach-challengers/

The Shopify Rebellion Game Changers roster, the reigning two-time champions, have made history. The women became the first GC team to qualify for a VALORANT Challengers event, after years of attempts.

The roster core that has dominated the women’s VALORANT scene has finally overcome their greatest obstacle on the path to their ultimate goal: the international VCT leagues.

Shopify Rebellion Makes History

While the Shopify Rebellion Game Changers team has dominated the GC circuit, they had always fallen short of advancing past qualifiers into Challengers. For VALORANT teams, the Challengers leagues are the path to the Ascension event, a regional tournament that determines who is promoted to the international VCT leagues.

After winning their second Game Changers Championship in December, Shopify were dealt a huge blow when their star Ava “florescent” Eugene signed with VCT EMEA team Apeks. In doing so, flor became the first Game Changers player to compete in VCT, but it left a big hole in the roster for Shopify to fill. 

Just prior to the North American Challengers closed qualifier, Shopify found their replacement in Karnthida “dodonut” Chaisrakeo. In the closed qualifier, Shopify overcame dodonut’s former team, FlyQuest RED, before beating Funhaver to secure the third and final qualifier spot in NA Challengers.

For the Shopify Rebellion organization, fresh off their merger with content creator stars Cr1TiKaL and Ludwig’s Moist Esports, they will field two roster in NA Challengers, as their men’s roster returns after competing in the league last year. Organizations are permitted by Riot to field two teams in the same ecosystem, provided one of them is eligible to compete in Game Changers. The Shopify GC roster is the two-time champion of Game Changers, so they should be permitted to compete when the NA Challengers League stage one begins later this month.

Can the Shopify Rebellion Game Changers players reach VCT? Tell us what you think below and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the exclusive report on what’s coming to Xbox Game Pass in February.
